TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CloudJobSchedule extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IInheritedBehaviors, class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IRefreshable

Docs.summary: A job schedule that allows recurring jobs by specifying when to run jobs and a specification used to create each job.
A job schedule that allows recurring jobs by specifying when to run jobs and a specification used to create each job.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void CommitChanges(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Commits all pending changes to this to the Azure Batch service.

remarks.para: Updates an existing on the Batch service by replacing its properties with the properties of this which have been changed. Unchanged properties are ignored. All changes since the last time this entity was retrieved from the Batch service (either via , , or ) are applied. Properties which are explicitly set to null will cause an exception because the Batch service does not support partial updates which set a property to null. If you need to set a property to null, use .
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.summary: Gets the creation time of the job schedule.
Gets or sets a list of behaviors that modify or customize requests to the Batch service made via this .

remarks.para: These behaviors are inherited by child objects.
Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Delete(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Deletes this .
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The delete operation requests that the job schedule be deleted. The request puts the schedule in the state. The Batch service will delete any existing jobs and tasks under the schedule, including any active job, and perform the actual job schedule deletion without any further client action.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.param: A used for filtering the list and for controlling which properties are retrieved from the service.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the and .
Docs.summary: Enumerates the jobs created under this .
Docs.returns: An that can be used to enumerate jobs asynchronously or synchronously.
Docs.remarks: This method returns immediately; the jobs are retrieved from the Batch service only when the collection is enumerated. Retrieval is non-atomic; jobs are retrieved in pages during enumeration of the collection.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the schedule as metadata.
Gets the previous state of the job schedule.
Docs.remarks: If the schedule is in its initial state, the PreviousState property is not defined.

Docs.summary: Gets the time at which the job schedule entered its previous state.
Docs.remarks: If the schedule is in its initial state, the PreviousStateTransitionTime property is not defined.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Terminate(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Terminates this . Terminated schedules remain in the system but do not create new jobs.
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The terminate operation requests that the job schedule be terminated. The request puts the schedule in the state. The Batch service will wait for any active job to terminate, and perform the actual job schedule termination without any further client action.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .
